TopicTitle: Game crashes - black screen as output from graphics card stops [might be hardware-related]

Articles.Content:
Reported Version: v0.2.0 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: Windows 11 Home - 10.0.22621 | CPU: AMD Ryzen 7 2700x | GPU: Nvidea RTX3090 driver v546.33 | RAM: 32GB RAM

Expected - game to run without crashing

What happens - 

Game runs for up to 10 minutes before crashing. Monitor goes black and actually it loses signal from the graphics card. Can still hear sounds and num lock lights on keyboard work. But no way to return to windows so have to powercycle to recover. 

Issue seems more likely to occur when near Kerbin surface. 

 

Observations:

  • Issue did not seem to happen with KSP 2 before the For Science! update


Fixes tried:

  • Checked latest drivers, latest Windows Updates
  • Used verify integrity option in steam
  • Deleted existing KSP save data and started new game
  • Performed memory checker mdsched.exe with no issues found
  • No issues running other games
  • Reducing graphic settings
  • Tried setting KSP from Fullscreen to Borderless in settings.
